{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HR Officer",
  "description": "My-HRpro Consulting - Our client, a reputable dental clinic, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	Our client is a reputable dental clinic seeking a proactive HR Officer to support recruitment, onboarding, employee relations, and HR administration.


Responsibilities


	Recruitment and onboarding
	Employee records and HR documentation
	Attendance, leave, and payroll coordination
	Handling grievances and disciplinary processes
	Ensuring compliance with HR policies and clinic standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in HR or related field
	Minimum 2 years of HR experience.... CIPM Certified
	Strong communication and confidentiality
	Proficient in MS Office.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;citysmiledentalclinichr@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-27",

  },

HR Officer Job at My-HRpro Consulting




        
    

        
        My-HRpro Consulting - Our client, a reputable dental clinic, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	Our client is a reputable dental clinic seeking a proactive HR Officer to support recruitment, onboarding, employee relations, and HR administration.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Recruitment and onboarding
	Employee records and HR documentation
	Attendance, leave, and payroll coordination
	Handling grievances and disciplinary processes
	Ensuring compliance with HR policies and clinic standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in HR or related field
	Minimum 2 years of HR experience.... CIPM Certified
	Strong communication and confidentiality
	Proficient in MS Office.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: citysmiledentalclinichr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head of Internal Audit (Mortgage Bank)",
  "description": "Mecer Consulting Limited provides business and management consulting, general training, etc.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Internal Audit (Mortgage Bank)

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Finance, Banking, Economics, Business Administration, or a related discipline.
	A Master&rsquo;s degree (MBA, MSc, or equivalent) is an added advantage.
	Professional Qualifications (Mandatory / Strongly Preferred)
	Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN) or ANAN
	Certified Internal Auditor (CIA) is highly desirable
	Other relevant certifications such as CISA, CFE, or CRMA are added advantages


Experience:


	10&ndash;15 years of post-qualification experience in banking, financial services, or audit.
	At least 5 years in a senior internal audit or control role, preferably within a mortgage bank or regulated financial institution.
	Strong knowledge of mortgage banking operations, credit processes, and regulatory frameworks.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and&nbsp;qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@mecer.consulting&nbsp;using &quot;HIA-MT&quot; as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-02-08",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Mecer Consulting Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"

    "value": {

      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Head of Internal Audit (Mortgage Bank) Job at Mecer Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Mecer Consulting Limited provides business and management consulting, general training, etc.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Internal Audit (Mortgage Bank)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Qualifications
     

            
    




	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Banking, Economics, Business Administration, or a related discipline.
	A Master’s degree (MBA, MSc, or equivalent) is an added advantage.
	Professional Qualifications (Mandatory / Strongly Preferred)
	Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN) or ANAN
	Certified Internal Auditor (CIA) is highly desirable
	Other relevant certifications such as CISA, CFE, or CRMA are added advantages


Experience:


	10–15 years of post-qualification experience in banking, financial services, or audit.
	At least 5 years in a senior internal audit or control role, preferably within a mortgage bank or regulated financial institution.
	Strong knowledge of mortgage banking operations, credit processes, and regulatory frameworks.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@mecer.consulting using "HIA-MT" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Receptionist",
  "description": "SATL Freight Nigeria Limited, founded in 2020 is primarily a container logistics provider that services the shipping industry and offers a one stop solution to all clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Greet clients, visitors, and partners professionally.
	Answer and direct phone calls and inquiries.
	Manage front desk operations and office records.
	Schedule appointments and manage meeting rooms.
	Support administrative tasks as needed.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a receptionist or front desk officer.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Friendly, professional, and well-presented.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Basic computer skills (Microsoft Office).


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@satlfreight.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2026-02-24",

  },

Receptionist Job at SATL Freight Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        SATL Freight Nigeria Limited, founded in 2020 is primarily a container logistics provider that services the shipping industry and offers a one stop solution to all clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Greet clients, visitors, and partners professionally.
	Answer and direct phone calls and inquiries.
	Manage front desk operations and office records.
	Schedule appointments and manage meeting rooms.
	Support administrative tasks as needed.


Requirements
     

            
    




	Proven experience as a receptionist or front desk officer.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Friendly, professional, and well-presented.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Basic computer skills (Microsoft Office).


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@satlfreight.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Fibre Planner",
  "description": "WIOCC is the leading player in the deployment of carrier-scale, future-proofed network infrastructure into Africa. We have the flexibility and scale to meet the ever-growing demand for reliable, high-speed capacity throughout Africa, driven by end consumers, enterprise users and the ecosystem that supports them. Our policy of continual investment in our network to create Africa&rsquo;s first, truly hyperscale network infrastructure means ongoing investment for growth, ensuring our readiness to meet the future data volume demands of end users throughout Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fibre Planner

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)
Category: Engineering
Reporting Line: Fibre and Facilities Manager

Job Objective


	Plan access and core fibre routes to make use of existing ducts and where required new routes. To be acknowledged as 3rd level technical competence relating to network fibre planning.


Key Duties &amp; Responsibilities


	Plan and design of new access, metro and core duct and fibre routes, spurs, and PoP sites entries, Fttx
	Liaise with internal Project Managers and 3rd party suppliers that ensure fibre networks are designed and deployed according to design
	Planning of new access and core duct and fibre routes, spurs and PoP sites
	Liaise with internal Project Managers and 3rd part suppliers for the execution of designed plans
	Plan wayleaves and manage rights of way
	Assist with management &amp; planning of overall fibre network, including auditing and record management
	Assist other departments and lead and report on projects as requested
	Ensuring network design aligns with NetSuite as appropriate


Minimum Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree (or equivalent work experience) in a technical field


Minimum Experience &amp; Skills:


	Minimum of 3 years of technical experience in telecom industry with at least 2 years in network engineering, network fibre design or equivalent role
	Knowledge of platforms including Ducts, Fibre, DWDM (10/40/100G), OTN
	Knowledge in supporting TX equipment i.e. Alcatel, Adva, Ciena, Infinera, Tejas Networks etc
	Quality assurance auditing &amp; testing, manage and mitigate network risk register
	Optical networking experience including OTDR, optical link budget calculations, fibre types and testing
	Ability to analyse fibre test results; OTDR/OLTS
	Experience in Google Earth, QGIS and OSS systems
	Effective written and verbal communications skills evidenced by work history and accomplishments
	Excellent communications and soft skills, including ability to listen to and summarize and concisely share key information with Clients
	Must use B/OSS tools effectively to record information accurately and concisely in a timely manner
	Demonstrate ability to manage multiple priorities and solve problems in a fast-paced environment
	Strong analytical skills and able to collate and interpret data from various sources
	Excellent English language communicator with a natural aptitude for dealing with people
	Excellent network diagnostic and problem-solving skills


Attributes:


	Client focused, relationship builder
	Integrity, honest with high ethical standards
	Boundless, passionate, and flexible
	Personal excellence, accuracy, and attention to detail
	Collaborative, achieve results through teamwork and partnerships.
",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-23",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-24",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "WIOCC Nigeria Limited"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "193484"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,

}



Fibre Planner Job at WIOCC Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        WIOCC is the leading player in the deployment of carrier-scale, future-proofed network infrastructure into Africa. We have the flexibility and scale to meet the ever-growing demand for reliable, high-speed capacity throughout Africa, driven by end consumers, enterprise users and the ecosystem that supports them. Our policy of continual investment in our network to create Africa’s first, truly hyperscale network infrastructure means ongoing investment for growth, ensuring our readiness to meet the future data volume demands of end users throughout Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fibre Planner
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)
Category: Engineering
Reporting Line: Fibre and Facilities Manager

Job Objective


	Plan access and core fibre routes to make use of existing ducts and where required new routes. To be acknowledged as 3rd level technical competence relating to network fibre planning.


Key Duties & Responsibilities


	Plan and design of new access, metro and core duct and fibre routes, spurs, and PoP sites entries, Fttx
	Liaise with internal Project Managers and 3rd party suppliers that ensure fibre networks are designed and deployed according to design
	Planning of new access and core duct and fibre routes, spurs and PoP sites
	Liaise with internal Project Managers and 3rd part suppliers for the execution of designed plans
	Plan wayleaves and manage rights of way
	Assist with management & planning of overall fibre network, including auditing and record management
	Assist other departments and lead and report on projects as requested
	Ensuring network design aligns with NetSuite as appropriate


Minimum Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent work experience) in a technical field


Minimum Experience & Skills:


	Minimum of 3 years of technical experience in telecom industry with at least 2 years in network engineering, network fibre design or equivalent role
	Knowledge of platforms including Ducts, Fibre, DWDM (10/40/100G), OTN
	Knowledge in supporting TX equipment i.e. Alcatel, Adva, Ciena, Infinera, Tejas Networks etc
	Quality assurance auditing & testing, manage and mitigate network risk register
	Optical networking experience including OTDR, optical link budget calculations, fibre types and testing
	Ability to analyse fibre test results; OTDR/OLTS
	Experience in Google Earth, QGIS and OSS systems
	Effective written and verbal communications skills evidenced by work history and accomplishments
	Excellent communications and soft skills, including ability to listen to and summarize and concisely share key information with Clients
	Must use B/OSS tools effectively to record information accurately and concisely in a timely manner
	Demonstrate ability to manage multiple priorities and solve problems in a fast-paced environment
	Strong analytical skills and able to collate and interpret data from various sources
	Excellent English language communicator with a natural aptitude for dealing with people
	Excellent network diagnostic and problem-solving skills


Attributes:


	Client focused, relationship builder
	Integrity, honest with high ethical standards
	Boundless, passionate, and flexible
	Personal excellence, accuracy, and attention to detail
	Collaborative, achieve results through teamwork and partnerships.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Account Payables Officer",
  "description": "Emzor Pharmaceutical Industries is one of Nigeria&#39;s leading pharmaceutical companies, dedicated to providing premium, affordable medical treatments. We have been manufacturing pharmaceutical and health products for over 40 years. We are promoting unlimited wellness by offering innovative, long-lasting medical solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Payables Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	The Accounts Payable Officer is responsible for processing supplier invoices, ensuring timely and accurate payments, maintaining vendor accounts, and supporting financial controls in line with company policies and accounting standards.


Key&nbsp;Responsibilities&nbsp;
Invoice Processing &amp; Payments:


	Verify and process supplier invoices accurately and on time.
	Perform 3-way matching (PO, GRN, Invoice) where applicable.
	Prepare and process payment runs (bank transfers, cheques, electronic payments).
	Ensure adherence to agreed payment terms and cash flow planning.


Vendor Management:


	Reconcile vendor accounts and resolve discrepancies.
	Respond to vendor queries and manage payment-related communications.


Accounting &amp; Reporting:


	Post AP transactions accurately in the ERP/accounting system.
	Reconcile the AP sub-ledger with the general ledger.
	Assist with month-end and year-end closing activities.
	Prepare AP ageing reports and analysis.


Compliance &amp; Controls:


	Ensure compliance with internal controls, approval workflows, and delegation of authority.
	Support internal, external, and statutory audits.
	Ensure compliance with tax requirements such as withholding tax and VAT


Process Improvement &amp; Support:


	Identify opportunities to improve AP processes and efficiency.
	Support automation and ERP enhancements.
	Maintain proper documentation and records.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree or Higher National Diploma in Accounting, Finance, or a relevant field..
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in Accounts Payable
	A professional qualification (ICAN or ACCA equivalent) is an added advantage


Key Competencies:


	High level of integrity, accuracy, and attention to detail.
	Good problem-solving skills
	Good understanding of AP processes and controls
	Time management and the ability to meet deadlines.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
	A supportive and dynamic work environment with clear career growth opportunities.
	Comprehensive medical insurance, pension, and other employee benefits.
",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-23",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-31",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Emzor Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd"
    
  },

Account Payables Officer Job at Emzor Pharmaceutical Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Emzor Pharmaceutical Industries is one of Nigeria's leading pharmaceutical companies, dedicated to providing premium, affordable medical treatments. We have been manufacturing pharmaceutical and health products for over 40 years. We are promoting unlimited wellness by offering innovative, long-lasting medical solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Payables Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

            
    




	The Accounts Payable Officer is responsible for processing supplier invoices, ensuring timely and accurate payments, maintaining vendor accounts, and supporting financial controls in line with company policies and accounting standards.


Key Responsibilities 
Invoice Processing & Payments:


	Verify and process supplier invoices accurately and on time.
	Perform 3-way matching (PO, GRN, Invoice) where applicable.
	Prepare and process payment runs (bank transfers, cheques, electronic payments).
	Ensure adherence to agreed payment terms and cash flow planning.


Vendor Management:


	Reconcile vendor accounts and resolve discrepancies.
	Respond to vendor queries and manage payment-related communications.


Accounting & Reporting:


	Post AP transactions accurately in the ERP/accounting system.
	Reconcile the AP sub-ledger with the general ledger.
	Assist with month-end and year-end closing activities.
	Prepare AP ageing reports and analysis.


Compliance & Controls:


	Ensure compliance with internal controls, approval workflows, and delegation of authority.
	Support internal, external, and statutory audits.
	Ensure compliance with tax requirements such as withholding tax and VAT


Process Improvement & Support:


	Identify opportunities to improve AP processes and efficiency.
	Support automation and ERP enhancements.
	Maintain proper documentation and records.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree or Higher National Diploma in Accounting, Finance, or a relevant field..
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in Accounts Payable
	A professional qualification (ICAN or ACCA equivalent) is an added advantage


Key Competencies:


	High level of integrity, accuracy, and attention to detail.
	Good problem-solving skills
	Good understanding of AP processes and controls
	Time management and the ability to meet deadlines.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
	A supportive and dynamic work environment with clear career growth opportunities.
	Comprehensive medical insurance, pension, and other employee benefits.
    

    

        Click here to Apply
